section: The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fee in the amount of $450. The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees at their discretion and convenience.
explanation: This clause presents conflicting information regarding payment responsibility. While it states the customer is responsible for paying the fee, it also says they can pay at their 'discretion and convenience.' This contradicts the earlier statement by implying the customer has the option not to pay, creating ambiguity and rendering the payment obligation unenforceable.

section: This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement, which notice must be given not less than fifteen (15) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term. Either party may terminate this Agreement without cause at any time effective upon fifteen (15) days' written notice.
explanation: There are conflicting periods of time set. It states that the agreement automatically renewed for one month. It also states that 'either party may terminate this Agreement without cause at any time effective upon fifteen (15) days' written notice.'

section: i-on will be liable under any circumstances for any lost profits or other consequential damages, even if i-on has been advised as to the possibility of such damages. i-on's liability for damages to the Customer for any cause whatsoever, regardless of the form of action, and whether in contract or in tort, including negligence, shall be limited to one (1) month's fees and the remaining portion of any prepaid fees.
explanation: This edit creates a contradiction regarding i-on's liability. The original text sets it at 0. This edit sets it to 'one (1) month's fees and the remaining portion of any prepaid fees.'
